thread.title: Bobbi Kristina Biopic in the Works, Vivica A. Fox Already Cast
thread.title_full: Bobbi Kristina Biopic in the Works, Vivica A. Fox Already Cast

author: Jessica Bennett
title: Bobbi Kristina Biopic in the Works, Vivica A. Fox Already Cast
text:
February 13, 2017 by Jessica Bennett 0 Shares Advertisement 
Just one year after Lifetime produced their own Whitney Houston biopic , daughter Bobbi Kristina has officially been chosen as the focus of the next big celebrity story told on screen. 
Even better, some pretty reputable names have been linked to the project, giving it the credibility many felt her mother’s biopic lacked. 

With the recent success of BET’s The New Edition Story , many networks are looking to capitalize off the television biopic genre. 
TV One has reportedly locked down the rights to Bobbi Kristina’s story, according to TheJasmineBrand. 
Credit: Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images 
“TV One feels like they can tell her story in a way that will resonate with her fans,” the source revealed. 
They continued, “There’s so much about her life that some people didn’t know about – outside of the headlines. They think they can pull it off.” 
Credit: Instagram 
The network isn’t playing any games either, already casting the role of deceased icon Whitney Houston with House of Payne star, Demetria McKinney. 
“Demetria has the voice and she’s an actress.” 
A photo posted by Demetria McKinney (@demetria4real) on Feb 11, 2017 at 7:10pm PST 
Vivica’s Black Magic host Vivica A. Fox has reportedly been cast as Pat Houston, Bobbi Kristina’s aunt who worked closely with Whitney before her untimely death. 
A photo posted by Vivica A Fox (@msvfox) on Feb 11, 2017 at 8:01am PST 
Bobbi's boyfriend Nick Gordon took the time to remember mother and daughter this weekend, as Grammy weekend marks the 5th anniversary of Whitney's death. Can't believe it's been 5years.. I miss you. I know you and Kriss are enjoying each other up there. RIH pic.twitter.com/xPnwnPIpHl — Nick Gordon (@Nickdgordon) February 11, 2017 
Whitney died the night before the Grammys back in 2012, with daughter Bobbi Kristina passing away just three years later. 

What do you think of Bobbi Kristina’s life hitting the small screen? Sound off below.
